title: Infotainment Software Test Engineer
description:
Ängelholm On-site  



The Koenigsegg Infotainment & Cloud team is responsible for designing and developing software for the Infotainment system, Koenigsegg's Cloud and Mobile App. We are working very closely with the other engineering departments, production and service/aftersales.

  


We are now looking to expand the team with a skilled and experienced software test engineer with the ability to transform product and system requirements for Intotainment and Telematics into test cases and also to develop our test environment to further improve the quality of the software development.



 The responsibilities associated with this position puts a strong requirement on your ability to cooperate with other departments in other technical domains. The test activities will stretch from designing automated tests to script testing and exploratory testing within the Infotainment team.

  

**Responsibilities**


* To Develop Detailed Test Plans, Test Cases and Perform Test Execution to ensure System/Software Quality
* To Derive Test Requirements from Systems Requirements
* To Develop Automated Tests from Derived Test Requirements/Plans
* To Perform Manual Tests to Validate the Systems Requirements
* To Design and Develop Test Benches in conjunction with Experts based on the Vehicle Architecture
* To Support Multiple Engineering Departments Primarily Production and Service Departments
* Work with a Small, Agile, Cross Functional Team of System Designers, Hardware Afficionados, Platform Architects, Software Wizards, Test Engineers and DevOps Specialists.
* To Assure Quality, On Time Delivery and Solve it Once for All Approach on All Deliverables

  
Skills & Requirements


**Need To Have**


* Minimum 3 years of Relevant, Postgraduate, Full Time, Experience
* Experience in Software Testing, Test Automation Development and/or QA Engineering
* Good Knowledge on Test Techniques, Test Methods, Test Tools and Test Reporting Mechanisms
* Proven Programming Skills in Python/Bash
* Experience with Agile Development Process (Git, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Jira, CI/CD)
* Desire and Ability to work in a Self-Driven, Multi-Tasking, Result Oriented, Highly Dynamic Environment
* Willingness to Adapt Fast and Learn New Technolgies
* Fluency in English


**Meritorious**


* Experience with CAN Bus Analyzers & Communications Protocols
* Experience in Auotmotive Test Techniques, Test Methods, Test Automation for Infotainment and Telematics Systems
* Experience in Programming Languages such as C/C++
* Experience with Over the Air (OTA) Update Systems/Technologies
* Experience in ISO 26262
* Experience in Designing/Building Test Benches and HW Knowledge


**Availability**


* According to Agreement
* Full time
Great Place to Work


Opportunity to impact a growing company


Work alongside world-class talent


Flexible work schedules + Culture of collaboration


Long track record of success and profitability


Engaging and sharing work environment


Quick decision making, flat hierarchy


About the company


Koenigsegg is most known for building some of the fastest cars in the world; with almost all of our megacar technologies that are patented and made in-house by our almost 500 world-class technicians, engineers, sourcing experts, production craftsmen, and communicators.


What we’ve created is a unique proving ground of engineering creativity that makes use of our breakthrough megacar development and legacy to push the boundaries of sustainable mobility technology.



So, what’s next?


We are on a universe-denting mission to develop the next generation of breakthrough tech and products. We are looking for outstanding, impactful, and authentic individuals to grow with us. Our ambitions are inspiring but will push the limits of what is possible – requiring one to work efficiently amid our cross-functional teams to execute at high-quality levels.


**The goal is clear: innovate and transform.**

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga en hållbar spelindustri med hjälp av den senaste teknologin? Då kan det här vara rollen för dig! ATG rekryterar just nu två Seniora DevOps Engineers till vår Operations-avdelning.
   

  

**I rollen får du**
* Arbeta med skickliga kollegor i en inspirerande och föränderlig marknad
* Designa, dela och implementera förbättrade lösningar för vårt team och andra team
* Förbättra och tillhandahålla en containerplattform till team och användare inom ATG
* Arbeta flexibelt och få balans i livet


**Är det här du?**
 För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du har en bra förståelse för hur utvecklingsarbete fungerar för att kunna genomföra konstruktivt samarbete med andra team i organisationen. Vi ser att du har en god förståelse för modern containerbaserad teknologi, både inom OnPrem-lösningar och molnbaserad infrastruktur. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper, och vi tror därför att du är en person som är nyfiken, ödmjuk, självständig men också en bra lagspelare. Vi ser att du är öppen för nya lärdomar och gärna delar med dig av din kunskap. Vidare bör du ha en god kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Vi söker efter en person som har några års arbetserfarenhet av/inom:
   

  

* Kubernetes
* Linux (Red Hat)
* AWS (gärna certifierad)
* Terraform
* GO och Python
* Rapportering och övervakningsverktyg (Grafana, Prometheus, Elasticsearch)
* Agilt arbetssätt
* Kravinsamling, dokumentation
* Lagring och meddelandehantering
* Git/Github
* Jira
* OpenShift


 Det är meriterande om du tidigare har arbetat med Docker, Ansible och Puppet.
   

  

**”Laget före jaget”**
 Jag är stolt att jobba för ATG, där vinsten av vår verksamhet går till ett högre syfte. Men även den transparens som finns från högsta ledning till att för mig få jobba med kompetenta människor och teknik i framkant. Sen uppskattar jag möjlighet till träning och alla aktiviteter som ordnas. Som ledare tänker jag laget före jaget, att vi tillsammans som ett team kan bygga något fantastiskt. Därför tycker jag också det är viktigt att ansvar och beslut tas så mycket som möjligt i teamen och som leder till innovation. När jag inte jobbar spenderar jag mycket tid med familj och vänner, jag gillar också skidåkning och segling sommartid.
   

  

* Rekryterande chef, Håkan Fahlén, Manager IT Core Infrastructure


**We are the game**
 I närmare 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
   

  

**Join the game!**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och kommer att göra en bakgrundskontroll för denna roll. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!
   

  

 På grund av sommarsemestrar kommer urvalet av ansökningarna att tas upp igen i augusti. Trevlig sommar!
   

  

 Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
   

  

* Occupational pension
* Tjänstepension
* Work-life balance
* Personal trainer and gym facilities at the office
* Personlig tränare och gym på kontoret
* Wellness allowance
* Friskvård
* Fri parkering
* Free parking
* Hund på jobbet
* Dog at the office


 Om företaget
   

  

**Så här har vi det** 
 Hos oss är du del av en innovativ miljö och med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar du den bästa spelupplevelsen. Vi gillar att samarbeta och hos oss får du stort utrymme att påverka ditt arbetssätt. Här hittar du nyfikna, nytänkande medarbetare och ledare – viktiga egenskaper för att kunna utveckla och utvecklas. Liksom energi , mod och motivation.
   

  

 För att må bra är skrattmuskeln lika viktig att träna som alla andra muskler. Både den fysiska och den mentala hälsan skapar balans i livet. Hur vi har det på jobbet påverkar privatlivet- och vice versa. Vi ser det som en självklarhet att ge det stöd och de verktyg som behövs. Ditt val av arbetsplats och arbetssätt är flexibelt och vi lägger stor vikt på självledarskap.
   

  

 Vi bryr oss om varandra och respekterar varandras olikheter på ATG. Och vi vill att våra kunder ska må bra och ha roligt när de spelar. Vi bryr oss också om sportens välmående, dvs. idrottarna och hästarna - och samhället runt omkring oss. Vi drivs inte av privata vinstintressen utan allt överskott går tillbaka till våra ägare, svensk trav- och galoppsport, något som både känns och gör gott.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
*Learnster is a cutting-edge learning management system committed to revolutionizing how organizations approach employee development. Our human-centered approach blends innovative technology and AI with a dedication to empowering individuals and fostering learning cultures. Learnster comprises 45 engaged individuals, 200+ customers, and users across 30+ countries. Join us on our trailblazing journey to reshape the future of workplace individual learning!* 




  





**Job description** 




  





 Are you a versatile full-stack software engineer who thrives on crafting end-to-end solutions in a curious and fast paced environment? Have you got a track record of developing SaaS products using Python, TypeScript, and Angular? If so, you might be exactly the one we're looking for!
 



  





 We're on the hunt for a full-stack software engineer who wants to join us on our quest to help employees of our customers in their individual learning and growth journeys! We believe that you're a skilled engineer with a passion for technology and a drive to solve customer problems. We believe that you have a DevOps mindset where you care about the entire lifecycle of a solution, from ideation to development and deployment, and that you do that with open eyes and a learning mindset.
 



  





**Your role will include** 




  





 As a Software Engineer at Learnster, you’ll be involved in the whole development lifecycle, where you contribute with everything from ideation and solution design to development, testing and deployment.
 



  





 You'll do this in close collaboration with other developers, designers and product managers since we believe that the best solutions come when people with different skills and background work together finding the best solutions.
 



  





**To thrive in this role you'll have the following skills and experience** 




  




* **Full-stack development experience:** 
*Experience as a full-stack software engineer, with a strong portfolio of solutions developed using Python, TypeScript, and Angular.*
* **Python Development:** 
*Solid experience in Python development, specifically with the Django framework.*
* **TypeScript Development:** 
*Proven skills in TypeScript development for both front-end and back-end solutions.*
* **Angular:** 
*Experience in building Single Page Applications (SPA) using Angular.*
* **Database design and development:** 
 Experience using both relational and non-relational databases and experience writing SQL code to retrieve and modify data.
* **AWS Solution Development:** 
*Experience in designing and implementing solutions on AWS, leveraging both AWS managed services and cloud-agnostic technologies.*
* **DevOps Mindset:** 
*A strong understanding of DevOps principles, with a focus on the entire lifecycle of a software solution. This includes a keen interest in why we build solutions, how we build them, and ensuring they perform optimally once deployed.*



  





 It's also a plus if you've got experience working with frameworks or technologies such as React, NextJS, NodeJS, Vercel Cloud, Langchain, OpenID Connect and SAML.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* *An exciting journey in a scale-up with strong investors*
* *Flexible work arrangements (remote/on-site)*
* *Health and wellness benefits*
* *Continuous learning opportunities within a vibrant, innovative team*
* *Six weeks of paid vacation plus 3 extra free days per year*
* *A culture that values diversity and promotes personal development*



  





**We look forward to meeting you!** 




  





*Join a fast-growing and awarded SaaS company, where you will play a key role in shaping Learnster’s future.* 




  





*At Learnster, you will work with passionate and ambitious colleagues, ready to take ourselves, our team, and the company to the next level!* 




  





 Please send your application in if you think that you would be a good fit for this position and if you think that Learnster might be a place for you! We look forward to meeting you!

title: Azure Architect
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Vill du arbeta på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser?**
 Sopra Steria, Nordens ledande företag inom digital transformation, söker en erfaren och kompetent Senior Azure Arkitektkonsult med dokumenterad erfarenhet för att stärka vårt framstående team. Vi har blivit erkända som Karriärföretag och en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work. I denna roll kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i leveransen av innovativa molnbaserade projekt till våra kunder samt bidra till vidareutvecklingen av vårt framstående molnerbjudande
   

  

**Som arkitektkonsult inom Azure kommer du att:**
* Delta aktivt i planering och design av Azure-lösningar för våra kunder.
* Operativt arbeta med lösningar som omfattar hela bredden av Azure-plattformen, inklusive IaaS och PaaS, med fokus på Azure AD för identitets- och säkerhetsstyrning.
* Coacha och vägleda kunder om optimal användning av moln- och hybridteknologi för att implementera nya lösningar eller migrera befintliga till Azure.
* Fungera som ämnesexpert som stödjer flera team eller som teknisk teamledare med övergripande ansvar för leveransen.


**För att lyckas med detta tror vi att du:**
* 5 till 8 års dokumenterad erfarenhet som Azure-arkitekt med stark teknisk och problemlösningsförmåga.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Förmåga att automatisera och optimera arbetsflöden.
* Erfarenhet av att översätta kundens behov till konkreta designförslag och implementeringar.
* Erfarenhet från konsultbranschen med förmåga att arbeta i både stora och små team.


**Kvalifikationer och färdigheter:**
* Erfarenhet av design och implementering av lösningar i det offentliga molnet, med fokus på säkerhet, skalbarhet och prestanda.
* Kompetens inom programmerings- och/eller skriptspråk (Powershell, Bash, Python etc.).
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg som Azure DevOps.
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (ARM, Terraform etc.).
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av containerlösningar som Docker och Kubernetes.
* Förståelse för IP-nätverkskoncept som VPN och DNS.
* Expertis inom Azure AD och relevanta behörighetsprocesser.
* Kunskap inom molnsäkerhet.


**Om Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är en global aktör inom digital transformation med över 60 000 medarbetare i över 30 länder, varav 600 i Sverige. Vi har blivit rankade som en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work och är ett av topp fem bolag inom Digital Transformation enligt Gartner. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och skicklig arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att vässa dina kunskaper och arbeta med branschens mest spännande projekt.
   

  

 Vi står nu inför en spännande tillväxtresa som genomsyrar hela verksamheten där det finns stora möjligheter att växa tillsammans med bolaget och skapa verklig förändring genom digital utveckling.
   

  

**Har du fler frågor?**
 Om du har några fler frågor angående tjänsten får du gärna höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare Teodor Nellvik (teodor.nellvik@soprasteria.com).
   

  

 Sopra Steria tar inte emot CV:n från företag som vi inte har ramavtal tillsammans med. Vi tar inte ansvar för eventuella avgifter på CV:n som skickas oönskat till oss.
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies without a base agreement: Sopra Steria does not accept resumes from agencies with whom we do not have an agreement. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Sopra Steria employees or any other company location. Sopra Steria is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Security Operations Engineer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, TV channels and production studios. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Security Operations Engineer** 
 for our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The role**
 We’re looking for a Security Operations Engineer to manage and implement best-in-class web cybersecurity to protect our platform at all times.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, you enjoy the technical details. You will be working with engineering to evaluate and configure new observability and monitoring systems. Also, you will be researching and adopting new security measures, ideating new scenarios for incident xresponse dry-runs and tabletop exercises. This is a hands-on role where you will work both individually and be part of a wider community with whom you will collaborate closely.
   

  

 Viaplay is in the forefront of the streaming industry offering both VOD and Live Sports content, which means that the stakes are constantly high since customers count on a stable and uninterrupted viewing experience. We offer a diverse workplace, a learning culture and a high degree of autonomy.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Owning and evangelizing web cybersecurity initiatives as part of Technical Operations
* Ownership of the edge security domain including Web Application Firewalls, automatic mitigation, third-party integrations, monitoring, and data processing pipelines
* Security Operations including monitoring, detecting, analyzing, and responding to web security events
* Collaborate with product engineering to help secure their web applications and APIs against web security threats
* Full-stack development of security tooling in support of Security Operations


**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience of Security Operations and DevOps
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Cybersecurity, or a related field, or equivalent experience, with at least 3 years in IT security or related roles
* Knowledge of security vulnerabilities in web and mobile platforms and proficiency with advanced security tools for detection and remediation
* Strong communication skills for effective collaboration and leading security initiatives
* Experienced with AWS cloud services and security solutions including AWS WAFv2
* Experience with Splunk Cloud or similar observability environments
* Full-stack application development, experience in Golang, JavaScript and Python


**Our offering** 
  

  

* We’ve got the basics covered (and then some)! 30 days of paid vacation every year and extra compensation on top of a parental pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We have an attractive pension and insurance scheme with full health care coverage should you need it.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill with the freedom to try new things in autonomous teams. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development, while always making sure you feel supported with regular knowledge-sharing sessions, technical training, mentorship opportunities and peer-to-peer networks.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including live sports & pay per view events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Senior Backend Developer (Python)
description:
**Senior Backend Developer – Stockholm, Hybrid** 




 Are you passionate about building innovative backend solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products with a focus on robust backend systems?
 



  





**What's in it for you?** 




 You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on backend development, allowing you to dive deep into complex systems and data infrastructure.
 



  





 Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.
 



  





 You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård) and private pension contribution.
 



  





**What you'd be doing?** 




 You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.
 



  





 Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers. Key technologies you'll work with include Python, Django, FastAPI, Kubernetes, Airflow, PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, Kafka, and RabbitMQ.
 



  





 You'll be responsible for designing and implementing scalable backend systems, optimising performance, and ensuring data integrity and security.
 



  





  





**About you?** 




 You have at least 4 years of experience in backend development, with a strong focus on Python and frameworks such as Django and FastAPI. You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.
 



  





 You’d have experience with DevOps practices (like Kubernetes, Docker, Git), cloud platforms (like AWS/Azure), and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools. Leadership experience and strong communication skills would also be good here, as you'll be able to mentor team members and interface with clients whilst contributing to the evolution of backend development practices within the team.
 



  





 Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
 



  





**A bit about them?** 




 A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.
 



  





 The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.
 



  





 With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.
 



  





  





*Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to will@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.* 




  





  





*3 stage Interview Process* 



1. *Initial Chat*
2. *Technical Discussion*
3. *Final with CEO*

title: Software Engineer in Product Development
description:
**Why Pixelgen?** 




 At Pixelgen our mission is to develop groundbreaking bio-analytical tools to revolutionize the world’s understanding of health and disease. As a part of our collaborative start-up team you will contribute with your expertise while making a real impact on the scientific community and beyond.
 



  





**The role** 




 We are looking for a Software Engineer driven by curiosity and who wants to solve challenging problems yet untackled. Software is a key element of our company. The discipline that glues together our assay, our data and our operations. This is a position where you can design, build, test and ship software while making a difference to the world. We are developing state of the art algorithms, highly distributed computational infrastructures, analysis environments and rich visualization tools.
 



  





 You are an engineer whose passion is to help others to get the most out of their data by building infrastructure and software solutions. You also have a flair for analysis, and visualization. You have proven experience of working in collaborative environments in biotech or academia.
 



 In this role, you will be mentored by the CDAO and work hand-in-hand with other senior colleagues. You will have ample opportunity to learn new and exciting things. We are now building our software team and seeking a highly motivated, skilled, and adventurous team member to join us on our journey.
 



  





 This position requires approx. 40-60% on-site presence in Pixelgen’s Stockholm office.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Architect, design, build, test and ship Pixelgen Technologies production-ready software
* Keep updated with most current industry practices and apply them
* Be an ambassador for good software development practices at Pixelgen Technologies
* Foresee and tackle with your colleagues architectural challenges in order to best scale up
* Developing interactive applications for both the web and the high-performance systems that empower our RnD team
* Developing customer-facing software for academic, biotech and pharma clients
* Collaborating with our Design Lead to create intuitive and memorable user interfaces and experiences
* Make use of prototyping in an Agile manner and quick iterations to demonstrate proof of concepts
* Participate in recruitment of the most talented software engineers
* Help product management, business development and leadership teams to understand competitive market forces and determine which new features and services to build



  





**Requirements** 



* 2+ years of professional software development experience
* Experiences in software team best practices
* Significant experience developing web applications with using one or more common development frameworks and best practices associated to organization of these kind of applications
* Knowledge of modern Javascript/TypeScript and CSS features
* Demonstrated experience developing data-driven systems with scientific applications in the cloud. Knowledge of different cloud infrastructures and automatic deployment systems
* Well-honed engineering skills that are language or platform agnostic, but specific preference for Python, Rust, C/C++ and interfacing across these.
* Detailed knowledge of Linux-based operating systems with strong understanding of performance effect, file systems, network layers, compilers, DBMS and language runtimes
* Knowledge of the development life-cycle including automated software testing and devops practices.
* Experience in deploying applications either to the cloud or within a production manufacturing environment.
* Experience designing long-term data storage in a variety of database systems and cloud stores, and the knowledge to know what storage schemes and solutions are best suited for Pixelgen Technologies data types
* Analytical mindset and quantitative thinking
* Collaborative spirit with excellent communication skills
* High self-motivation: take initiatives, have the ability to run multiple parallel activities and at the same time have the ability to keep focus to reach project goals according to set timelines



  





**Preferred requirements** 



* Previous delivery of software for the main mobile platforms
* Mastering at implementing high-performance graph algorithms and using software libraries, APIs or systems that deal with graph structures and methods
* Problem-solver regardless of the tech stack being used
* Demonstrated experience contributing to open source software professionally or as side projects
* A PhD or background in biology is not required, but scientific curiosity and data-driven decision making is encouraged across the company



  





**About Pixelgen** 




 At Pixelgen Technologies we develop novel analytical methods and products capable of seeing the inner workings of life. These products help researchers and drug developers to gain new insights in biomedicine and ultimately improve health. Our offices and labs are located at the recently opened
 **Forskaren building** 
 within the growing Life Science cluster at Hagastaden in Stockholm, Sweden. Do you want to work at a company that offers a groundbreaking technology that will bring biological understanding to the next level? Come join our dynamic team!
 



  





*Pixelgen does not accept unsolicited applicants submitted by third-party recruiters or agencies. Any resume or application submitted to Pixelgen without a vendor agreement in place will be considered unsolicited and property of Pixelgen, and Pixelgen will not pay a placement fee.*

title: Systemtekniker till Riksidrottsförbundet!
description:
Idrottsrörelsen är inne i en dynamisk förändringsprocess. Här drivs idrott i förening för att ha roligt, må bra och utvecklas hela livet och varje dag tar vi ännu ett steg på resan mot en mer nyfiken och välkomnande idrottsrörelse. IT-avdelningen ansvarar för att ge support till anställda och alla våra medlemsförbund samt förvaltar och utvecklar IT-miljön med fokus på säkerhet och tillgänglighet. Som System- och drifttekniker är du en viktig del i att säkerställa att idrottens medlemmar friktionsfritt kan arbeta med de digitala verktygen. Har du några års erfarenhet inom drift och är redo för nästa steg? Häng med på vår resa!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, 100%
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Riksidrottsförbundet (RF) är idrottsrörelsens samlande organisation med uppgift att stödja, företräda, leda och samordna idrottsrörelsen i gemensamma frågor, såväl nationellt som internationellt. Riksidrottsförbundet har 72 medlemsförbund (specialidrottsförbund, SF) som tillsammans har cirka 19 000 idrottsföreningar och totalt samlar idrottsrörelsen cirka 3,3 miljoner medlemmar vilket innebär ett stort antal användare av förbundets digitala verktyg. Du kommer ett ingå i ett team om fyra personer samt din närmsta chef och ni jobbar tillsammans främst med driften av idrottens administrativa verksamhetssystem IdrottOnline, en integrationsplattform, Microsoft 365 samt den infrastruktur som krävs för den digitala arbetsplatsen. Dina kollegor finns på två olika arbetsplatser - Idrottens Hus vid Skanstull och Bosön på Lidingö. Arbete kan förekomma på bägge arbetsplatserna men du kommer främst att spendera din arbetstid på kontoret i Skanstull.
 


  


  

**Några ord från din framtida närmsta chef:**



  


 Hej, Jag heter Victoria och är IT-chef på Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund och SISU Idrottsutbildarna. När jag började här för drygt 2 år sedan möttes jag av en otroligt välkomnande och trevlig arbetsplats där alla arbetar för visionen Svensk idrott världens bästa. Digitaliseringen går snabbt och för att trivas här måste man vara lösningsfokuserad och inspireras av nya utmaningar. Inom verksamhetsområdet IT och Digital utveckling arbetar vi i nära samarbete med varandra vilket skapar en bra sammanhållning där vi både utvecklar och stöttar varandra i det dagliga arbetet och dess utmaningar. Som ledare är mitt mål att coacha och stötta mina medarbetare i att utmana sig själva och att utvecklas. Jag kommer att finnas där som bollplank för alla typer av frågor, från stöd i övergripande tekniska beslut till att hitta nya sätt att lösa utmaningar.
   

 Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team där vi tillsammans gör allt för att stötta hela Sveriges idrottsrörelse!
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Arbete i en roll där du får jobba brett med olika uppgifter inom IT-drift
  
* Arbete i organisation där det händer mycket och som är under snabb utveckling vilket vi tror kommer ge dig goda möjligheter att utvecklas i din roll
  
* En välkomnande arbetsgivare som värnar om trivsel och välmående på arbetat genom att erbjuda möjligheten till tre dagars arbete på kontor och två dagars på distans per vecka (om arbetet tillåter), 2 timmars friskvård i veckan, 3000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag per år samt lunchförmåner. Här finns också en trivselgrupp vars uppgift är att skapar det där lilla extra sociala i vardagen på jobbet!
  


  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Du kommer huvudsakligen jobba med att hantera driften av IT-miljön vilket innebär övervakning, installation, uppgradering, konfigurering, utveckling samt optimering av infrastrukturen för IdrottOnline, integrationsplattformen samt Microsoft 365. Detta är en roll för dig och som vill jobba brett och lära dig nya tekniker och arbetssätt. Du kommer framförallt att jobba med drift av Windowsservrar men Riksidrottsförbundet jobbar utöver det bland annat med Linux, Cisco, Meraki, Docker, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Terraform, Gravitee, ArgoCD, Curity, Microsoft Dynamics 365 m.fl. och är det områden du inte kan sedan innan så är det något du kommer få utvecklas och lära dig mer inom här!
   




**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och intresse för tjänsten och Riksidrottsförbundet som organisation. Vi ser att du är duktig på att samarbeta, du gillar att tänka nytt och att utveckla dig själv och att ta ansvar för såväl din egen utveckling som det gemensamma resultatet i teamet.
 


  


  

**Vidare har du…**



  

  
* Minst några års erfarenhet av drift, underhåll, konfigurering och felsökning av system och nätverk
  
* Kunskaper inom Windows Server
  
* Kunskaper inom Microsoft Azure
  
* Kunskaper inom DevOps
  
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska då det är det primära arbetsspråket
  


  


  

**Vi ser det som meriterande om du också har…**



  

  
* Kunskaper inom Kubernetes
  
* Kunskaper inom SQL
  
* Kunskaper inom Microsoft 365
  


  


  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Problem- och personlighetstester
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work
  
* Intervjuer med Riksidrottsförbundet
  
* Referenstagning + beslut
  


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Placering: Skanstull, möjlighet till visst distansarbete
  
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: Heltid
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund**

 Läs mer om Riksidrottsförbundet på deras hemsida !
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Johanna Sörell eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106090

title: Team manager R&D - Data driven applications
description:
**Team manager R&D - Data driven applications**
===============================================

Functional area: Research and Development
Country: Sweden
City: Stockholm, Sweden
Company name: Atlas Copco Industrial Technique AB
Date of posting: Aug 3, 2024  

***Work at the heart of the Industry 5.0 transformation – the integration of artificial intelligence, robotics and the human factors of manufacturing - as manager for a new R&D team!***

  


Our systems empower industry users to manage the configuration of our products in one powerful application. The aim is to continue strengthen production sites across the world with innovative solutions for resilient and sustainable industrial production.

  


**The role**  

You lead one of two cross functional teams with approximately 16 engineers developing software focusing on production data, traceability and analytics. Your team develops cloud SaaS solutions and on-prem software with web and app customer user interfaces. This is done in close cooperation with Marketing and other R&D teams with the aim to develop customer centric solutions.


In addition to leading your team, you work with technology roadmaps, research and technology activities, cyber security and process development. You are part of steering groups and the Quality Critical Software department's management team.  

  

Some job areas:


* Create a learning and motivating environment and make people grow
* Meet our society's need of strengthened cyber security
* Be a stakeholder in the SAFe process
* Continuously improve our development process and collaborations

  




**City:** Nacka, Stockholm. We have a hybrid work situation.

  


**Your profile**  

You have a technical academic degree within Computer Science, or other relevant area, and experience from leading software teams as a project or team manager.  

You have experience working within the SAFe framework and with product development processes. Experience from working with Inclusion & Diversity is a plus. Good communication skills and a genuine interest in leadership are essential. You are engaging and have a strategy for creating an open working climate.

  


**We offer you**  

At Atlas Copco, we foster a friendly atmosphere and uphold a culture of respectful interaction and ethical behavior. We value individuals who bring their authentic selves to work, contributing to our collective success. As pioneers in the industry, we’re passionate about driving dynamic change and empowering manufacturing customers.

  


You are welcome to contact recruiting manager Joakim Gustafsson, joakim.h.gustafsson@atlascopco.com, if you have further questions. We are looking forward to your application via our jobsite!

  


As part of the selection process, Atlas Copco Industrial Technique AB may perform a background check on final candidates.

  





**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**  

Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.
company_description: Atlas Copco provides compressed air & vacuum equipment, industrial power tools, construction equipment, and rental options.

title: Senior Regional Alliances Manager, Nordics
description:
**Get to know Okta**  

  

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.

**The Okta Alliances team is growing across the Nordic region!**



Okta is looking for a Sr Regional Alliances Manager with strong deal, strategy and relationship management experience to support Okta’s SI Partners with the aim of extending and enhancing Okta’s position across the Nordic region.



The ideal candidate will possess a strong background within Channel and Partner management along with an understanding of all the elements that are required to enable partners to be successful with the Okta solution.



A Sr Regional Alliances Manager at Okta will need to think strategically and analytically about business, product and technical challenges, with the ability to create compelling value propositions and work cross-organisationally to build consensus to drive revenue. We are looking for someone who is creative, proactive and looking to expand and advance their Regional Alliances knowledge. We want you to grow as Okta grows!


**As an Okta Regional Alliances Manager you will:**


* Drive pipeline and revenue within the partner ecosystem across the Nordic region
* Support partner program management and thought leadership across an assigned partner base to increase revenue and drive business opportunities
* Collaborate with Okta’s Executive, Marketing, Sales and Presales teams to drive a successful partnership for both Okta and our partners
* Define tailored value propositions and create detailed go-to-market plans that strengthen our value proposition to the marketplace while providing new revenue opportunities
* Serve as the partner advocate inside Okta; evangelise partners and the opportunities they present by injecting partner DNA into Okta field sales
* Build relationships with partner sales teams to keep Okta “front and centre” for appropriate opportunities

**You could be a great fit for this role if you have:**


* Proven experience of alliances at a SaaS company, successfully demonstrating Channel/Field Alliances strategy to drive increased sales
* A track record of exceeding channel sales revenue targets
* A business leader who is able to influence and build strong relationships with decision makers across all levels of partner and prospect organisations
* Current knowledge of the trends and market leading companies in the broader Cloud Computing and Identity Management ecosystem across the Nordic region
* Experience with Cloud Software Vendors and their strategies/business models;
* A high degree of honesty, integrity and sound judgment

**You might also have:**


* Understanding of and experience with Identity & Access Management, Single Sign-on and API-based solutions
* BSc/BA degree or equivalent (preferred but not essential) or relevant industry experience


#LI-JB2



#LI-Hybrid

**What you can look forward to as an Full-Time Okta employee!**


* Amazing Benefits
* Making Social Impact
* Fostering Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging at Okta


Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.



Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and convictions records, consistent with applicable laws. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please use this Form to request an accommodation.



Okta is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy at https://www.okta.com/privacy-policy/.
  
**Okta**The foundation for secure connections between people and technology
Okta is the leading independent provider of identity for the enterprise. The Okta Identity Cloud enables organizations to securely connect the right people to the right technologies at the right time. With over 7,000 pre-built integrations to applications and infrastructure providers, Okta customers can easily and securely use the best technologies for their business. More than 18,800 organizations, including JetBlue, Nordstrom, Slack, T-Mobile, Takeda, Teach for America, and Twilio, trust Okta to help protect the identities of their workforces and customers.
company_description: Okta is the foundation for secure connections between people and technology.

title: Sustainability Senior Manager - Net Zero Lead
description:
**Sustainability at Accenture**


We collaborate closely with clients and ecosystem partners top help transition industries to low-carbon energy; design and deliver net-zero circular supply chains and reduce the carbon footprint of IT, cloud, and software. Through deep industry expertise, analytics, and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown.


Through Sustainability Strategy, we help clients identify new areas for growth, new ways to increase efficiency and reduce cost, and new means to build trust and reputation, while addressing sustainability issues and global constraints. By focusing on sustainability as a means for value creation, we help business leaders build trust and transparency, and create competitive advantage.

**Position Overview:** The Senior Manager - Net Zero Lead, will play a pivotal role in our organization, leading the Nordic Sustainability Strategy Net Zero efforts internally within Accenture and externally in the market. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of experience, a solid background in sustainability/net zero/climate, with strong experience in the renewable energy sector, and preferable prior consulting experience.  

  

**This role requires** collaboration with various industry and market teams to deliver impactful projects, including climate compliance, carbon intelligence, energy transition and management, capital projects, and decarbonization strategies.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Lead Net Zero strategy in the Nordics**: Be the point person for Net Zero within our sustainability strategy team in the Nordics externally and internally.
* **Client Project Management**: Manage and deliver impactful client projects related to climate compliance, carbon intelligence, energy transition and management, capital projects, and decarbonization strategies.
* **Collaboration**: Work closely with industry teams to leverage expertise and deliver comprehensive sustainability solutions.
* **Business Development**: Identify and pursue new business opportunities in the utilities sector and other relevant industries.
* **Thought Leadership**: Stay up to date with the latest industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices in sustainability and climate action.
* **Stakeholder Engagement**: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, industry partners, and internal teams to facilitate collaboration and drive project success.
* **Team Leadership**: Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a collaborative and high-performing work environment.

**What´s in it for you:**  

  

Accenture is an incredible place to work. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. Our commitment to you includes:

* A transparent approach to career progression, with a focus on your strengths and continuous coaching from senior colleagues.
* Competitive salary, good bonus schemes, occupational pension schemes and other benefits
* Ability to craft your career based on your own aspirations, having support from your own People Lead.
* Work-life balance: good arrangements to combine family life with work and active support for mental health.
* Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well Inclusion & Diversity network.

  

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience**: Minimum of 8 years of experience in sustainability/net zero/climate, in the renewable energy sector, and preferably in consulting.
* **Education**: Bachelor’s degree in environmental science, Sustainability, Engineering, Business, or a related field. A master’s degree is preferred.
* **Technical Skills**: Proven experience with climate compliance, carbon intelligence, energy transition and management, capital projects, and decarbonization strategies. Experience with SAP is highly desirable.
* **Project Management**: Strong project management skills with a track record of successfully delivering complex projects on time and within budget.
* **Business Acumen**: Demonstrated ability to develop new business opportunities and lead proposal development.
* **Communication**: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to diverse audiences.
* **Collaboration**: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships with clients and partners.
* **Leadership**: Strong leadership skills with experience in mentoring and guiding team members.


Preferred office location: Stockholm or Copenhagen.


Interested?


Apply as soon as possible by attaching your CV, cover letter and your educational documents including grades.

**Thank you for your interest in joining Accenture. Due to the summer holiday season, our response time might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in August and get back to you shortly after.**  

  

**About Sustainability Strategy**


We are a global practice within Accenture Strategy & Consulting, working closely with clients and ecosystem partners top help transition industries to low-carbon energy; design and deliver net-zero circular supply chains and reduce the carbon footprint of IT, cloud and software.


Through deep industry expertise, analytics and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown. To stay agile in a world dominated by change, the C-suite must keep the core business running while simultaneously identifying and investing in the new. Accenture Strategy & Consulting enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology.  

  

**About Accenture**


Accenture is a leading global corporation offering a wide range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digitalization, technology, and operations. Accenture has approximately 740,000 employees serving clients in more than 120 countries, addressing the challenges faced by companies, organizations, and agencies with enthusiasm, knowledge, insight, and technology.  

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**


All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.


Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.


Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Digital Marketing Intern
description:
Industry
  
  

Computer Software
  
  

Category
  
  

Marketing
  
  

Experience
  
  

Entry level
  
  

Experience

**Workspace type:** Hybrid
  
  

Contact Person
  
Frank Melander
  
  

frank.melander@priceedge.se
  
+46 70 090 53 88
  
Job Description
  
  

We are building a really cool pricing software, and now we are seeking a Marketing Intern to support our sales & marketing activities. At Price Edge you will have an exciting and unbounded role, which includes working and learning at the same time.
  
  

What you'll do!
  
  

As a Marketing Intern, You'll be in charge of writing and researching material for our blog & whitepapers, & what else is needed to support our ongoing social media campaigns. You will also be working actively with our SEO/SEM.
  
  

All your efforts will about be creating concrete results, not just driving traffic or building brand awareness. You will be working close to our sales and product development teams. As a modern marketer, we believe you need a solid understanding of all those components.
  
  

Note that this is an part-time unpaid internship position for ~2-4 months, with the possibility to extend to paid part-time or freelance once completed if mutually satisfied.
  
  

Skills & Requirements
  
  

We believe the key to thriving as a marketer at Price Edge is curiosity, drive and being able to constantly test and iterate to find new ways forward. You are passionate about digital marketing and constantly seeking ways to improve. As a person, you are analytical and enjoys creative problem-solving. You find it easy to understand cause and effect, which enables you to develop and execute online strategies that will be successful.
  
  

To be successful as an marketing intern at Price Edge you need the following traits:
  
  

Currently studying or recent graduate in the fields of marketing, journalism, or creative writing
  
Experience or interest in tech and/or pricing
  
Good command over the English language, sentence structures, and well versed with creating captions/copies on image creatives
  
Passion for both storytelling and understand what’s trending within tech and the “pricing world”
  
Excellent understanding of campaign communication, CTAs
  
Experience in Wordpress, blogging, article writing, press releases and social media
  
Comfortable with hands-on execution and works effectively with tight deadlines
  
Knowledge of SEO/SEM
  
  

What will you love about us?
  
  

Your opinion will matter, and you will from day one be a key member in team that wants to build something big. You will get be able to bring your ideas to life while working within a flexible environment and time. Our office is a great place to work, but you can also work from home or in a park when you feel for that.
  
  

About the company
  
  

Price Edge is developing the dream pricing software - a cloud-based price optimization & management tool for enterprises, that give them access to new pricing strategies and more flexibility than ever before. Price Edge is working with many of the largest brands in the world and we have recently started to ramp up our global growth. We are a young, energetic team pursuing the vision of building a global B2B SaaS company that will fundamentally change the way enterprises work with pricing.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**We are hiring at Microdeb for a Customer Success Manager to join our growing team in Gothenburg!**


As a Customer Success Manager/Desk Based Account Manager, you will manage opportunities and retain and grow revenues across Direct and Indirect (FM) Partner Accounts, acting as the single point of contact for all inbound inquiries. Your primary responsibilities include overseeing the existing account base, managing the annual renewal process, and enhancing key relationships with client stakeholders. You should be an experienced, proactive self-starter capable of working independently and as part of a team, with a thorough understanding of facilities management and competitor portfolios. Excellent customer service and proven sales ability are essential, along with previous B2B and Facilities Management (FM) account management experience.


Our company is a leader in providing innovative cloud services and payment solutions to a diverse range of clients. With a robust portfolio of products, including cloud services, payment systems, and more, we are dedicated to enhancing transaction efficiency and user experience across various industries. We are now seeking a dynamic and experienced Customer Success Manager to join our team in Gothenburg.

**Here is a little window into our company:** Microdeb was acquired by Valsoft and now operates under the Aspire Software portfolio. Aspire Software, the operational arm of Valsoft Corp, operates and manages Valsoft’s global portfolio of wholly owned software companies, providing mission-critical solutions across multiple verticals. By implementing industry best practices, Aspire delivers a time-sensitive integration process, and the operation of a decentralized model has allowed it to become a hub for creating rapid growth by reinvesting in its portfolio.

**The successful candidate will be based anywhere within commutable distance of our office in Gothenburg, working in a hybrid work model!**

**What your day will look like:**

* Retain and grow revenue for assigned accounts, achieving all targets and KPIs while reducing customer churn
* Develop and execute contact and account strategies based on client needs
* Build strong relationships with decision-makers and act as the single point of contact for queries, resolving issues swiftly
* Proactively identify and pursue new business opportunities with existing customers
* Develop skills and knowledge to sell the full portfolio of products and services
* Manage opportunities via our CRM system and maximize revenue through cross-selling and upselling
* Provide monthly reports and continuous feedback to Senior Management
* Engage with clients to understand their needs, monitor satisfaction, and address issues promptly
* Conduct regular check-ins and business reviews, deliver training sessions, and advocate for clients internally to inform product development and strategy

**About You:**

* **Demonstrable successful track record in a similar sales role**
* **Detailed knowledge of all services across the product and solution portfolio**
* **Previous experience growing and retaining revenues across a given account based**
* **Success in proactively identifying and winning new business**
* **Proven track record of achieving targets and meeting KPI’s**
* Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate confidently and professionally over the phone and in written content
* Ability to articulate the business USPs
* Ability to analyse customer needs and recommend solutions which meet those needs
* Excellent time management and organisational skills and the ability to prioritise own workload
* Ability to work on own initiative
* Able to handle account issues in a patient and friendly manner
* Strong interest in SaaS technologies and willingness to learn and share knowledge
* **At least a professional level of English, both written and verbal**
* **Legally authorized to work in Sweden**

For further information about **Microdeb**, you can visit our website at https://microdeb.se

**We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.**

title: Junior Account Manager (English and Spanish speaking) to Linköping
description:
The company has developed a groundbreaking cloud service for transportation companies. They have customers all over the world.
  
They are experiencing strong demand of their product and because of that they need to strengthen their sales with a Spanish and English speaking salesperson.
  
We are looking for an outgoing and self-motivated Spanish and English speaking person who wants to work with sales from the company's office in Linköping towards North America.
  
  

About you
  
Qualifications for this job
  
* A couple of years’ experience in B2B sales.
* Excellent customer assistance and problem solving skills.
* Fluent in English and Spanish with no accent.


We see it as a positive if you have previous experience in working with international SaaS sales.
  
  

About this position
  
You will mostly work with assigned qualified leads.
  
A lead is a transportation company who is looking to upgrade their booking system.
  
You will work with the full sales cycle from first demo to a closed deal. After the deal is closed you will continue working with the customers to make sure we keep them happy.
  
The sales will mainly be done via web meetings and phone, so travelling will not be required for this position.
  
It is a very developing job in an international environment where you will interact with a lot of people every day.

title: Onsite Support
description:
**Onsite Support (Temporary role September-December)**
======================================================

  


*Are you ready to kickstart your IT career in a vibrant,* welcoming *environment? Join our team and gain hands-on experience!*

  


We are looking for a motivated and service-minded individual eager to start their career in IT. As part of our project team, you'll be instrumental in upgrading laptops from an On-premises solution to a modern Microsoft Cloud / Endpoint-based solution. You will have the opportunity to engage with users from various backgrounds and roles, ensuring their transition is smooth and efficient.

  


**Here are some examples of key responsibilities during a typical day:**


* Contacting and scheduling appointments with end-users.
* Configuring and redeploying laptops.

  




**Why join us?** By joining our team, you become part of a fun and friendly group with a great atmosphere. You will have the chance to work with a Nordic team of IT supporters while primarily focusing on the Stockholm/Uppsala region. The role is also allowing you to experience diverse work environments and meet a variety of people.

  


**To excel in this role**, it is essential to be an individual who is enthusiastic, self-motivated, and committed to continuous learning. You're expected to take initiative in overseeing your own responsibilities and meet the weekly targets for both laptop replacements and system updates.

  


* Basic computer skills and a keen interest in IT.
* Proficiency in Swedish or English together with good communication skills to be able to support the end-users.
* Beneficial to have some experience with ServiceNow and Active Directory.

  




If you are enthusiastic about IT and ready to dive into a role that offers both technical challenges and interpersonal engagement, we want to hear from you.

  


GlobalConnect is owned by EQT and is the fastest growing provider of connectivity solutions and digital infrastructure across Northern Europe. We are the result of recent mergers between Broadnet, GlobalConnect and IP-Only - now operating as one company in Norway, Denmark, Sweden, Germany and Finland. Our 1 600 employees ensure that we are the main challenger on each market by delivering secure and future proof solutions to some of the world’s largest companies as well as to private households. And everything in between.


We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.


Location:
Stockholm, SE, 111 34
Location:
Stockholm, SE, 111 34
With GlobalConnect being present in both Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Germany we have employees from many nationalities. We connect people and organizations across society. It starts with the foundation of our digital infrastructure and ends with all the things we enable. We strive to simplify the complicated and live by our customer promise and internal value-led behaviors - being E A S Y to work with (Expertise, Available, Speed, You).

title: Principal Architect, Telco, Google Cloud
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of experience as an enterprise architect or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role.
* Experience in cloud computing across applications, infrastructure, storage, platforms, data, and cloud market insights.
* Experience engaging with, and presenting to, technical stakeholders and executive leaders in the Telco industry.
* Ability to communicate in German fluently in order to interact in this customer-facing sales role.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Master's degree in Computer Science or a relevant technical field.
* Experience as an engineer in a cloud-computing environment or a customer-facing role, working as a member of a professional services or Systems Engineering team.
* Experience as Chief Security Officer or Technical Sales.
* Experience with Big Data, PaaS, and IaaS technologies.
* Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud technology.


**About The Job**
 The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build a trusted advisory relationship with strategic accounts and engage with Architects, VP engineering, and C-level. Identify customer priorities, technical objections and design strategies encompassing the entire Google ecosystem to deliver business value and resolve blockers.
* Provide domain expertise around public cloud and enterprise technology, and effectively promote Google Cloud with customers, at conferences and online.
* Make recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution providing best practice advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud effectiveness.
* Manage the holistic enterprise architecture relationship with customers by collaborating with specialists, product management, engineering, and more.
* Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

**has good hands on**

  with network devices and LAN, WAN , SDWAN, Zero Trust Network implementation with ability to work along Architects for design finalization.

title: Graduate Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.
   

  

 The role of a Graduate
 **Marketing Data Analyst** 
 at Canonical
   

  

 Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.
   

  

 The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.
   

  

 This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
* Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
* Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
* Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
* Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


 What we are looking for in you?
   

  

* A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
* Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
* Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
* Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
* Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

 🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
   

  

 📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum
   

  

 💰Annual compensation review
   

  

 🏆Recognition rewards
   

  

 🏝 Annual holiday leave
   

  

 👶Parental Leave
   

  

 🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme
   

  

 🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
   

  

 ✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
   

  

**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Onsite Support
description:
**Onsite Support (Temporary role September-December)**
*Are you ready to kickstart your IT career in a vibrant,* 
 welcoming
 *environment? Join our team and gain hands-on experience!*
 We are looking for a motivated and service-minded individual eager to start their career in IT. As part of our project team, you'll be instrumental in upgrading laptops from an On-premises solution to a modern Microsoft Cloud / Endpoint-based solution. You will have the opportunity to engage with users from various backgrounds and roles, ensuring their transition is smooth and efficient.
   

  

**Here are some examples of key responsibilities during a typical day:**
* Contacting and scheduling appointments with end-users.
* Configuring and redeploying laptops.


**Why join us?** 
 By joining our team, you become part of a fun and friendly group with a great atmosphere. You will have the chance to work with a Nordic team of IT supporters while primarily focusing on the Stockholm/Uppsala region. The role is also allowing you to experience diverse work environments and meet a variety of people.
   

  

**To excel in this role** 
 , it is essential to be an individual who is enthusiastic, self-motivated, and committed to continuous learning. You're expected to take initiative in overseeing your own responsibilities and meet the weekly targets for both laptop replacements and system updates.
   

  

* Basic computer skills and a keen interest in IT.
* Proficiency in Swedish or English together with good communication skills to be able to support the end-users.
* Beneficial to have some experience with ServiceNow and Active Directory.


 If you are enthusiastic about IT and ready to dive into a role that offers both technical challenges and interpersonal engagement, we want to hear from you.

title: AWS Cloud Solutions Architect
description:
🛠
 **️ About Redeploy Build** 




 At Redeploy Build, we are cloud specialists. What we do is build and integrate best-in-breed cloud environments, steering clear of legacy constraints and “old-IT”.
 



  





 We help our clients within all areas of public cloud - from building, governing, migrating and optimizing our client’s cloud resources. Living by a “Cloud always, in all ways” motto, we always get things done and are not just another powerpoint-firm, rather getting our hands dirty and putting tech into practice. Learn more about us here:
 
 https://www.redeploy.com/services/build
 




  





 As a rapidly growing public cloud company, we understand that our success depends on the talents we choose to surround ourselves with. Now we are looking for an AWS Cloud Solutions Architect in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Jönköping who wants to be a part of our continued success story. Maybe it's you?
 



  





  





**✍ About the role**
